analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Market sentiment is MIXED with medium conviction. Twitter shows strong bullish positioning (77% bullish) focused on AI/tech momentum, while RSS news and professional traders lean bearish (53% and 13% bullish respectively), citing guidance cuts, geopolitical tensions, and earnings quality concerns. The overall picture suggests a tactical consolidation phase with underlying structural uncertainty.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) AI infrastructure demand and mega-cap tech leadership continuing to dominate; (2) Year-end profit-taking and rotation risk in small/mid-caps alongside low holiday volume vulnerability; (3) Geopolitical uncertainty (U.S.-China tensions, Taiwan/Ukraine risks) and policy/regulatory headwinds creating near-term friction despite long-term structural tailwinds.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.31): Call Wall $700 (146k OI - active hedging at 1.4% away), Put Wall $640 (153k OI - dormant at 7.3% away). Max Pain $687. Near support: $670 (45k OI - active), $645 (126k OI - dormant). QQQ ($623.89): Call Wall $630 (33k OI - active at 1.0% away), Put Wall $590 (164k OI - dormant at 5.4% away). Max Pain $620. Near resistance: $640 (31k OI - active), $625 (29k OI - active). Per Twitter: SPX range 6,940â€“7,000 cited as critical inflection zone.
key_themes: AI infrastructure momentum vs. rotation risk
Year-end positioning unwind and holiday volume risk
Earnings quality deterioration and guidance revision risk
Breadth divergence (mega-cap strength masking small/mid-cap weakness)
risk_factors: Geopolitical escalation (Taiwan military, Ukraine commitment tightening)
Year-end profit-taking in small/mid-caps on low volume creating cascading liquidation
Earnings guidance cuts from software/fintech/discretionary sectors signaling demand softness
Regulatory/policy uncertainty and compliance cost inflation undercutting cyclical optimism
Bitcoin/crypto sector weakness despite crowded bullish positioning suggesting retail/trader capitulation risk
